subject: Snowstorm on Skull Island
event:
Will this damned snow ever cease?

Might be, might be.  Saw a sliver of sun last night.

(Oh, it's a gorgeous sunny happy day in Santa Fe.  Just not out on Skull Island).

Wrestling with a pair of krakens.  One almost subdued, t'other still writhing and twisting and slapping me alongside the head with her tenatcles.  After them, I've got a wolf to face.

comments.article: Go George Go!

Hi Geroge.  Thanks for another meaty update!  This one comes with a side of calamari too I see.  Squeeze some lemon and drizzle some tar-tar sauce on it and you have quite a feast!  I have been following this website for a while and I just wanted you to know that you have become my favorite editor/blogger/football commentator ever.  Glad to hear you are feeling better.  Don't work too hard wrestling with Kong this weekend.  Go out and enjoy that lovely New Mexico weather.  I have been hiking in the Sangre de Cristo Mountains several times.  Maybe we could get a group hike in the mountains together some time?
comments.subject: Let them eat calamari!  (cake for dessert?)
Re: Let them eat calamari!  (cake for dessert?)
Re: Let them eat calamari!  (cake for dessert?)
Re: Let them eat calamari!  (cake for dessert?)
Re: Let them eat calamari!  (cake for dessert?)
Re: Let them eat calamari!  (cake for dessert?)

comments.article: Beautiful down the road about 60 miles, too! It's a nice change from the blistering cold we were having. Probably time to tackle my outdoor projects the next couple days while it holds...
Sounds promising. Hopefully there aren't too many other creatures after the wolf.

The creatures never ends :P

In any case always good to have some news about. Go George, go!!
You're killing me, GRRM.
Shall we sharpen the harpoons?
SHARPEN THE HARPOONS!
Keep at it!
Do you find the snow inspriational when writing about the Wall?  I would think that would put me in a great frame of mind for writing about icy places.
Hear that?  That's the sound of all of us cheering you on.

I just hope that will be the two last chapters of Dance... :)

And by the way: that's a pity not to comment anything about the books here, i've got to hold my tongue!

Go on and thanks for a wonderful job!
Reminds me of a Restoration-era play that opened with the line, (Enter, strangling a wolf.). Good luck wrestling those krakens. :)
Great to see more DWD posts from you! Best of luck!
George, you need to jump into Abercrombies new book The Heroes.
Lucky you, I've got real snow in front of the door, but it's another continent... Need a showel? Or a harpoon?
comments.subject: Keep dancing George!

comments.article:
In Iowa it's nice and sunny and all that snow is melting away in front of our eyes.

Always rooting for the she-kraken.
comments.subject: always liked that she-kraken

comments.article: Hells yes

I love these posts.

Definitely makes for more exciting reading than the NFL Labor Talk. Though that is my new sad debate with a friend.

Which will come first. Another season for the NFL or A Dance with Dragons being finished. No definitive time for either sadly. Just thank the stars for HBO to distract us for a little while.
comments.subject: Love it

comments.article: Great stuff. Two Krakens and One Wolf. Any Knot work to do?

That feels good to know!! That you are progressing with ADWD I mean...

Makes my day :¬)


And by the way, FEAR NOT the beasts that you have to face! Meet every challenge with the knowledge (or anxiety) that you have a legion of supporters behind you spurring you on ;¬)
comments.subject: That feels good

comments.article: I was hoping you were close to being done...I'm so excited for this book I think I may lose my mind if it's not done soon...but hey Mr.Martin whenever it's done I'll be buying it..
comments.subject: damn

comments.upictitle: Popular series of fiction, fancy, and fact.: The classic madbard
comments.article: You are the last person who can complain about dumping long winters on people.

Surely you are talking about DANCES WITH DRAGONS. Is great news you are making progress!

Your post is reminding me of time I go hunting with Cousin Evgeny. Vacation to small town outside Novosibirsk yields many of opportunity for hunting in vast Russian forests. (Evgeny is very eccentric, he is wearing vest of bear pelt and belt full of ammunition...crazy cousins I have, all of them!) We were tracking wolf in snow, should be easy because of paw print, yes? But we track very deep in woods and get very lost very quick! But then we hear explosion and see smoke in tree line. Wolf has gotten clumsy and hit land mine from previous war! Was very scary!

I am telling you story because wolf saved lives. Evgeny and I turn around quickly and careful and make for village and vehicle to go home after seeing tragic wolf accident. I think of your novels Mr. Martin because wolf plays protective role.

Anyways I am for encouraging your mythical creature hunting. Perhaps if GRRM signing comes to Eastern Europe I can tell you more cheerful story and buy for you lunch of pizza, yes? (Russia and former Soviet Union have great patriotic tradition of pizza. Do not let outsiders tell you otherwise!)
We want calamari!
A wolf!? Ooooh, does Ghost get his own PoV? Or maybe Nymeria!

Want. This ^^^. Very much.

Except maybe a couple POV's from Nymeria's pack to set the stage, as Shakespeare would say, and we get Nymeria in a later entry, not unlike so many other surprise point of view characters. Remember all, no spoilers! Noobs abound.
It's very hard to have a sense of humour about this GRRM.  STOP TEASING ME!!!!  Aaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaah!!
comments.subject: omg . . . .

comments.article:
Release the Kraken Five, George!

Or fry them all up for a great calamari feast. I'm just dying to read what you've done with all the squids, wolves, dragons, and little lions. Great news, George.
